content: Subzone of Kallang Planning Area in Central Region, Singapore **Kampong Java** is a subzone within the planning area of [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), as defined by the [Urban Redevelopment Authority](/wiki/Urban_Redevelopment_Authority) (URA). It is bounded by the [Central Expressway](/wiki/Central_Expressway,_Singapore) (CTE) in the west; Balestier Road in the north; Tessensohn Road, Race Course Road, Gloucester Road, Northumberland Road and Tekka Lane in the east; and [Bukit Timah Road](/wiki/Bukit_Timah_Road) in the south. ## Etymology The area is named after the large number of [Javanese](/wiki/Javanese_people) living in the area, hence Java Village, or Kampong Java. ## Description Kampong Java is probably best known for being the location of [KK Women's and Children's Hospital](/wiki/KK_Women%27s_and_Children%27s_Hospital) and the headquarters of the [Land Transport Authority](/wiki/Land_Transport_Authority) (LTA). Other significant places within this subzone include the headquarters of [Tanglin Police Division](/wiki/Tanglin_Police_Division), Kampong Java Neighbourhood Police Centre, Pek Kio Community Centre, Balestier Plain, [Farrer Park Field](/wiki/Farrer_Park_Field), Farrer Park Tennis Centre, the [Singapore Indian Association](/wiki/Singapore_Indian_Association), the Singapore Khalsa Association, Kampong Java Park and Farrer Park Primary School. Part of the [Little India](/wiki/Little_India,_Singapore) ethnic district stretches into this area. Located within Kampong Java are [Little India MRT station](/wiki/Little_India_MRT_station) and [Farrer Park MRT station](/wiki/Farrer_Park_MRT_station). In August 2018, it was announced that Kampong Java Park would be closed to build a facilities building for the [Northâ€“South Corridor](/wiki/North%E2%80%93South_Corridor,_Singapore) tunnel, an expressway tunnel. This [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) location article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Kampong Java
